Your father has been a kind, tender husband.  For many years he served faithfully her whom he has always loved.  Death separated him from the one who for so long has been his special charge.  Then his sister was taken from him, and his home was broken up.  Is it any 
                                                                           120
wonder that under these circumstances he should, after your mother's death, become attached to a woman in whose conversion to the truth he was instrumental? This woman is not young, but of an age to be a help to him in his work.  Should your father's age have stood as a barrier to his happiness?...
